channel.title: Bank button sprites
channel.description:
just thought id release as some people might find it usefull i found it going through the 640 sprite dumps
http://www.megaupload.com/?d=I4UDE03Q
and guys dont even start flaming or stupid shit like that if you dont like it dont post i posted cause i figured some people might find this useful as i could never find one when i needed it

item.title: Bank button sprites
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:7, topic:387857”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=483652.msg3547994#msg3547994 date=1301308964]

Besides the fact it means nothing, you cannot ask for rep.

ahemm, if i do remember my first post… “if you dont like it dont post” gtfo

Woah woah woah, listen here little dipshit, you do NOT talk to vain like that. Hes right to question this, anyone with half a brain can rip jagex’s sprites off their clients, and this isn’t a tut so you gtfo sir.
[/quote]
andrew mad[/quote]
Damn right ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Bank button sprites
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I Vain I:

Don’t just re-post one; try gathering your own.

This.

Also, I’m going to start working on my cache extractor/converter. Basically what it will do is decompress the cache, and then save the files into something more usable. For example with images, it will save the raw image data into a usable format(jpg, png, etc), for different definitions I will probably convert it to XML. Doing something like this for interfaces

<!-- This is how my client is setup to load interfaces. -->
<!-- Not all features are supported yet but it's almost done. -->
<interface id="0">
    <frame x="15" y="15" width="200" height="200" background="path/to/background.jpg">
        <button type="push" background="path/to/button.jpg" text="Push Button" />
    </frame>
</interface>
<!-- etc. ->

Doing something different like that helps more than just compiling some images and archiving them.

Read full topic
